datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to using music for healing, relaxation, and emotional well-being.

columns.name: program_length_weeks
columns.description: Total length of the musical therapy program in weeks

columns.name: session_time_of_day
columns.description: Categorical indicator of when the therapy session is held (morning, afternoon, evening)

columns.name: initial_emotional_state_rating
columns.description: Patient's self-reported emotional state before starting the therapy sessions

columns.name: interactive_session_participation
columns.description: Frequency of participation in interactive music sessions per week

columns.name: therapy_session_frequency
columns.description: Number of therapy sessions attended per month

columns.name: mood_improvement_post_session
columns.description: Change in patient's mood rated on a scale from -5 to 5, where a positive number indicates an improvement.

columns.name: feelings_of_calmness
columns.description: Self-reported rating of calmness after the session on a scale of 1 to 10

columns.name: self_reported_wellness_score
columns.description: Average self-reported wellness score after the sessions

columns.name: session_duration
columns.description: Duration of each musical therapy session in minutes

columns.name: patient_stress_level
columns.description: Self-reported stress level of the patient before starting the therapy program, on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: musical_genre_preference_structured
columns.description: Indicates whether the patient prefers structured musical genres like classical or jazz (yes/no)

columns.name: preference_for_popular_music
columns.description: Binary indicator if the participant prefers popular music genres (1 = yes, 0 = no)

columns.name: relaxation_level
columns.description: Score indicating the level of relaxation the patient feels during the session, on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: session_frequency_per_week
columns.description: Number of therapy sessions attended by the patient per week.

columns.name: music_genre_variety
columns.description: Number of different music genres used during therapy sessions

columns.name: cognitive_response_score
columns.description: Score measuring the patient's cognitive response to music on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: patient_care_unit
columns.description: Type of care unit the patient is in (ICU, general ward)

columns.name: disturbance_after_music
columns.description: Scale from 1 to 10 measuring any negative effects or disturbances felt by the patient after the music therapy session

columns.name: stress_level_pre_session
columns.description: Patient's self-reported stress level before the therapy session, on a scale from 1 to 10.

columns.name: emotional_status_positive
columns.description: Boolean representation of whether the patient reported a positive emotional status post-session

columns.name: post_session_discussion
columns.description: Indicates if the patient engaged in a discussion about their emotional state after the session (yes/no)

columns.name: frequency_of_sadness
columns.description: Average number of times the participant felt sadness during the sessions per month

columns.name: heart_rate_variability_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of change in heart rate variability during the music therapy session compared to baseline

columns.name: live_classical_concert_attendance
columns.description: Number of live classical music concerts the patient attends per year.

columns.name: musical_taste_variety
columns.description: Quantitative measure of the participant's variety in musical preferences across different genres

columns.name: relaxation_during_music
columns.description: Scale from 1 to 10 measuring how relaxed the patient feels during the music therapy session

columns.name: emotional_stability_score
columns.description: Score measuring the patient's emotional stability on a scale from 1 to 10, related to how music affects their emotional state.

columns.name: non_work_hour_access
columns.description: Whether the patient has access to therapy sessions outside of standard working hours

columns.name: session_enjoyment_rating
columns.description: Patient's self-rated enjoyment of the therapy sessions on a scale of 1 to 10

columns.name: musical_interest_diversity
columns.description: Number of different musical genres the patient expresses interest in

columns.name: preference_for_live_music
columns.description: Binary indicator if the participant prefers live music performances (1 = yes, 0 = no)

queries.question: Is there a relationship between emotional stability score squared, live classical concert attendance, and preference for structured musical genres like classical or jazz music in the context of musical therapy?
